meanings.definition: A dish of rice cooked in a seasoned broth with meat and/or vegetables.
meanings.sent1: Mom made a delicious pilaw for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served a flavorful pilaw with chicken and carrots.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone loved the pilaw so much they asked for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the pilaw filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent5: The colorful pilaw on the plate looked like a work of art.

meanings.definition: To cook rice in a seasoned broth with meat and/or vegetables.
meanings.sent1: I will pilaw the rice for our family gathering this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She pilaws the rice perfectly every time, adding just the right amount of spices.
meanings.sent3: While trying to pilaw the rice, I accidentally spilled some broth on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The chef pilawed the rice with such skill that it tasted like a gourmet dish.
meanings.sent5: As the rice pilawed in the pot, the kitchen filled with a delightful aroma.
